active directory is a windows thing... presumably you must be using some kind of ldap or samba connector to AD
but the user would not appear in /etc/passwd if it were an LDAP or AD account
so if centrify was the interface to the AD server then you need to reinstall centrify

not by default, and since your account isn't a standard unix account anyways we are going to have to point you back to your AD server centrify configuration

su username won't work because the user doesn't exist unless the AD service is working

think about about the stuff in /etc/passwd. that is *all* you need to create an account, so things like LDAP and AD can just provide the required information (password auth process, $HOME location, UID and GIDs) to the login process, but without them it says "I don't know how to set $HOME or how to set GID or UID
